lemmatized_summary: This gene encode one of six different actin protein. actin be highly conserve protein that be involve in cell motility, structure, integrity, and intercellular signal. The encode protein be a major constituent of the contractile apparatus and one of the two nonmuscle cytoskeletal actin that be ubiquitously express. mutation in this gene cause Baraitser - Winter syndrome 1, which be characterize by intellectual disability with a distinctive facial appearance in human patient. Numerous pseudogene of this gene have be identify throughout the human genome.
geneFunction: This gene encodes one of six different actin proteins. Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in cell motility, structure, integrity, and intercellular signaling. The encoded protein is a major constituent of the contractile apparatus and one of the two nonmuscle cytoskeletal actins that are ubiquitously expressed. Mutations in this gene cause Baraitser-Winter syndrome 1, which is characterized by intellectual disability with a distinctive facial appearance in human patients. Numerous pseudogenes of this gene have been identified throughout the human genome.

Also known as
    ACT; ACTG; DFNA20; DFNA26; HEL-176
Summary
    Actins are highly conserved proteins that are involved in various types of cell motility and in maintenance of the cytoskeleton. Three main groups of actin isoforms have been identified in vertebrate animals: alpha, beta, and gamma. The alpha actins are found in muscle tissues and are a major constituent of the contractile apparatus. The beta and gamma actins co-exist in most cell types as components of the cytoskeleton and as mediators of internal cell motility. Actin gamma 1, encoded by this gene, is a cytoplasmic actin found in all cell types. Mutations in this gene are associated with DFNA20/26, a subtype of autosomal dominant non-syndromic sensorineural progressive hearing loss and also with Baraitser-Winter syndrome. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants.

lemmatized_summary: The protein encode by this gene be a large ( 700 kDa ) structural scaffold protein consist of a central domain with 128 aa repeat. The encode protein may play a role in such diverse process as blood - brain barrier formation, cell structure and migration, cardiac calcium channel regulation, and tumor metastasis. A much short variant encode a 17 kDa isoform exist for this gene, and the short isoform initiate a feedback loop that regulate alternative splice of this gene.
geneFunction: The protein encoded by this gene is a large (700 kDa) structural scaffold protein consisting of a central domain with 128 aa repeats. The encoded protein may play a role in such diverse processes as blood-brain barrier formation, cell structure and migration, cardiac calcium channel regulation, and tumor metastasis. A much shorter variant encoding a 17 kDa isoform exists for this gene, and the shorter isoform initiates a feedback loop that regulates alternative splicing of this gene.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a cell surface receptor and transmembrane precursor protein that be cleave by secretases to form a numb of peptide. Some of this peptide be secrete and can bind to the acetyltransferase complex APBB1 / TIP60 to promote transcriptional activation, while other form the protein basis of the amyloid plaque find in the brain of patient with Alzheimer disease. In addition, two of the peptide be antimicrobial peptide, have be show to have bacteriocidal and antifungal activity. mutation in this gene have be implicate in autosomal dominant Alzheimer disease and cerebroarterial amyloidosis ( cerebral amyloid angiopathy ). Multiple transcript variant encode several different isoform have be find for this gene.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a cell surface receptor and transmembrane precursor protein that is cleaved by secretases to form a number of peptides. Some of these peptides are secreted and can bind to the acetyltransferase complex APBB1/TIP60 to promote transcriptional activation, while others form the protein basis of the amyloid plaques found in the brains of patients with Alzheimer disease. In addition, two of the peptides are antimicrobial peptides, having been shown to have bacteriocidal and antifungal activities. Mutations in this gene have been implicated in autosomal dominant Alzheimer disease and cerebroarterial amyloidosis (cerebral amyloid angiopathy). Multiple transcript variants encoding several different isoforms have been found for this gene.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a sialoglycoprotein that be express on mature granulocyte and B cell and modulate growth and differentiation signal to this cell. The precursor protein be cleave to a short 32 amino acid mature peptide which be anchor via a glycosyl phosphatidylinositol ( GPI ) link to the cell surface. This gene be miss from previous genome assembly, but be properly locate on chromosome 6. Non - transcribe pseudogene have be designate on chromosome 1, 15, 20, and Y. Alternative splice result in multiple transcript variant.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a sialoglycoprotein that is expressed on mature granulocytes and B cells and modulates growth and differentiation signals to these cells. The precursor protein is cleaved to a short 32 amino acid mature peptide which is anchored via a glycosyl phosphatidylinositol (GPI) link to the cell surface. This gene was missing from previous genome assemblies, but is properly located on chromosome 6. Non-transcribed pseudogenes have been designated on chromosomes 1, 15, 20, and Y. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a member of the A1 family of peptidase. The encode preproprotein be proteolytically process to generate multiple protein product. this product include the cathepsin have light and heavy chain, which heterodimerize to form the mature enzyme. This enzyme exhibit pepsin - like activity and play a role in protein turnover and in the proteolytic activation of hormone and growth factor. mutation in this gene play a causal role in neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis - 10 and may be involve in the pathogenesis of several other disease, include breast cancer and possibly Alzheimer's disease.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a member of the A1 family of peptidases. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate multiple protein products. These products include the cathepsin D light and heavy chains, which heterodimerize to form the mature enzyme. This enzyme exhibits pepsin-like activity and plays a role in protein turnover and in the proteolytic activation of hormones and growth factors. Mutations in this gene play a causal role in neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis-10 and may be involved in the pathogenesis of several other diseases, including breast cancer and possibly Alzheimer's disease.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a isoform of the alpha subunit of the elongation factor - 1 complex, which be responsible for the enzymatic delivery of aminoacyl tRNAs to the ribosome. This isoform ( alpha 1 ) be express in brain, placenta, lung, live, kidney, and pancreas, and the other isoform ( alpha 2 ) be express in brain, heart and skeletal muscle. This isoform be identify as a autoantigen in 66 % of patient with Felty syndrome. This gene have be find to have multiple copy on many chromosome, some of which, if not all, represent different pseudogene.
geneFunction: This gene encodes an isoform of the alpha subunit of the elongation factor-1 complex, which is responsible for the enzymatic delivery of aminoacyl tRNAs to the ribosome. This isoform (alpha 1) is expressed in brain, placenta, lung, liver, kidney, and pancreas, and the other isoform (alpha 2) is expressed in brain, heart and skeletal muscle. This isoform is identified as an autoantigen in 66% of patients with Felty syndrome. This gene has been found to have multiple copies on many chromosomes, some of which, if not all, represent different pseudogenes.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a member of the GTP - bind translation elongation factor family. This protein be a essential factor for protein synthesis. It promote the GTP - dependent translocation of the nascent protein chain from the A - site to the P - site of the ribosome. This protein be completely inactivate by EF - 2 kinase phosporylation.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a member of the GTP-binding translation elongation factor family. This protein is an essential factor for protein synthesis. It promotes the GTP-dependent translocation of the nascent protein chain from the A-site to the P-site of the ribosome. This protein is completely inactivated by EF-2 kinase phosporylation.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode alpha - enolase, one of three enolase isoenzyme find in mammal. Each isoenzyme be a homodimer compose of 2 alpha, 2 gamma, or 2 beta subunit, and function as a glycolytic enzyme. Alpha - enolase in addition, function as a structural lens protein ( tau - crystallin ) in the monomeric form. Alternative splice of this gene result in a short isoform that have be show to bind to the c - myc promoter and function as a tumor suppressor. Several pseudogene have be identify, include one on the long arm of chromosome 1. Alpha - enolase have also be identify as a autoantigen in Hashimoto encephalopathy.
geneFunction: This gene encodes alpha-enolase, one of three enolase isoenzymes found in mammals. Each isoenzyme is a homodimer composed of 2 alpha, 2 gamma, or 2 beta subunits, and functions as a glycolytic enzyme. Alpha-enolase in addition, functions as a structural lens protein (tau-crystallin) in the monomeric form. Alternative splicing of this gene results in a shorter isoform that has been shown to bind to the c-myc promoter and function as a tumor suppressor. Several pseudogenes have been identified, including one on the long arm of chromosome 1. Alpha-enolase has also been identified as an autoantigen in Hashimoto encephalopathy.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode fibronectin, a glycoprotein present in a soluble dimeric form in plasma, and in a dimeric or multimeric form at the cell surface and in extracellular matrix. The encode preproprotein be proteolytically process to generate the mature protein. Fibronectin be involve in cell adhesion and migration process include embryogenesis, wind heal, blood coagulation, host defense, and metastasis. The gene have three region subject to alternative splice, with the potential to produce 20 different transcript variant, at less one of which encode a isoform that undergo proteolytic process. The full - length nature of some variant have not be determine.
geneFunction: This gene encodes fibronectin, a glycoprotein present in a soluble dimeric form in plasma, and in a dimeric or multimeric form at the cell surface and in extracellular matrix. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate the mature protein. Fibronectin is involved in cell adhesion and migration processes including embryogenesis, wound healing, blood coagulation, host defense, and metastasis. The gene has three regions subject to alternative splicing, with the potential to produce 20 different transcript variants, at least one of which encodes an isoform that undergoes proteolytic processing. The full-length nature of some variants has not been determined.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode the heavy subunit of ferritin, the major intracellular iron storage protein in prokaryote and eukaryote. It be compose of 24 subunit of the heavy and light ferritin chain. Variation in ferritin subunit composition may affect the rate of iron uptake and release in different tissue. A major function of ferritin be the storage of iron in a soluble and nontoxic state. defect in ferritin protein be associate with several neurodegenerative disease. This gene have multiple pseudogene. Several alternatively splice transcript variant have be observe, but their biological validity have not be determine.
geneFunction: This gene encodes the heavy subunit of ferritin, the major intracellular iron storage protein in prokaryotes and eukaryotes. It is composed of 24 subunits of the heavy and light ferritin chains. Variation in ferritin subunit composition may affect the rates of iron uptake and release in different tissues. A major function of ferritin is the storage of iron in a soluble and nontoxic state. Defects in ferritin proteins are associated with several neurodegenerative diseases. This gene has multiple pseudogenes. Several alternatively spliced transcript variants have been observed, but their biological validity has not been determined.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode the light subunit of the ferritin protein. Ferritin be the major intracellular iron storage protein in prokaryote and eukaryote. It be compose of 24 subunit of the heavy and light ferritin chain. Variation in ferritin subunit composition may affect the rate of iron uptake and release in different tissue. A major function of ferritin be the storage of iron in a soluble and nontoxic state. defect in this light chain ferritin gene be associate with several neurodegenerative disease and hyperferritinemia - cataract syndrome. This gene have multiple pseudogene.
geneFunction: This gene encodes the light subunit of the ferritin protein. Ferritin is the major intracellular iron storage protein in prokaryotes and eukaryotes. It is composed of 24 subunits of the heavy and light ferritin chains. Variation in ferritin subunit composition may affect the rates of iron uptake and release in different tissues. A major function of ferritin is the storage of iron in a soluble and nontoxic state. Defects in this light chain ferritin gene are associated with several neurodegenerative diseases and hyperferritinemia-cataract syndrome. This gene has multiple pseudogenes.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a member of the glyceraldehyde - 3 - phosphate dehydrogenase protein family. The encode protein have be identify as a moonlight protein base on its ability to perform mechanistically distinct function. The product of this gene catalyze a important energy - yield step in carbohydrate metabolism, the reversible oxidative phosphorylation of glyceraldehyde - 3 - phosphate in the presence of inorganic phosphate and nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide ( NAD ). The encode protein have additionally be identify to have uracil DNA glycosylase activity in the nucleus. Also, this protein contain a peptide that have antimicrobial activity against E. coli, P. aeruginosa, and C. albicans. study of a similar protein in mouse have assign a variety of additional function include nitrosylation of nuclear protein, the regulation of mRNA stability, and act as a transferrin receptor on the cell surface of macrophage. Many pseudogene similar to this locus be present in the human genome. Alternative splice result in multiple transcript variant.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a member of the glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase protein family. The encoded protein has been identified as a moonlighting protein based on its ability to perform mechanistically distinct functions. The product of this gene catalyzes an important energy-yielding step in carbohydrate metabolism, the reversible oxidative phosphorylation of glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate in the presence of inorganic phosphate and nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide (NAD). The encoded protein has additionally been identified to have uracil DNA glycosylase activity in the nucleus. Also, this protein contains a peptide that has antimicrobial activity against E. coli, P. aeruginosa, and C. albicans. Studies of a similar protein in mouse have assigned a variety of additional functions including nitrosylation of nuclear proteins, the regulation of mRNA stability, and acting as a transferrin receptor on the cell surface of macrophage. Many pseudogenes similar to this locus are present in the human genome. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants.

lemmatized_summary: The gene encode a member of the integrin alpha chain family of protein. integrin be heterodimeric integral membrane protein compose of a alpha chain and a beta chain that function as cell surface adhesion molecule. The encode preproprotein be proteolytically process to generate light and heavy chain that comprise the alpha 3 subunit. This subunit join with a beta 1 subunit to form a integrin that interact with extracellular matrix protein include member of the laminin family. Expression of this gene may be correlate with breast cancer metastasis.
geneFunction: The gene encodes a member of the integrin alpha chain family of proteins. Integrins are heterodimeric integral membrane proteins composed of an alpha chain and a beta chain that function as cell surface adhesion molecules. The encoded preproprotein is proteolytically processed to generate light and heavy chains that comprise the alpha 3 subunit. This subunit joins with a beta 1 subunit to form an integrin that interacts with extracellular matrix proteins including members of the laminin family. Expression of this gene may be correlated with breast cancer metastasis.

lemmatized_summary: integrin be heterodimeric protein make up of alpha and beta subunit. At less 18 alpha and 8 beta subunit have be describe in mammal. Integrin family member be membrane receptor involve in cell adhesion and recognition in a variety of process include embryogenesis, hemostasis, tissue repair, immune response and metastatic diffusion of tumor cell. This gene encode a beta subunit. Multiple alternatively splice transcript variant which encode different protein isoform have be find for this gene.
geneFunction: Integrins are heterodimeric proteins made up of alpha and beta subunits. At least 18 alpha and 8 beta subunits have been described in mammals. Integrin family members are membrane receptors involved in cell adhesion and recognition in a variety of processes including embryogenesis, hemostasis, tissue repair, immune response and metastatic diffusion of tumor cells. This gene encodes a beta subunit. Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants which encode different protein isoforms have been found for this gene.

lemmatized_summary: Amyloid precursor protein be process by beta - secretase and gamma - secretase to produce beta - amyloid peptide which form the characteristic plaque of Alzheimer disease. This gene encode a transmembrane protein which be process at the C - terminus by furin or furin - like protease to produce a small secrete peptide which inhibit the deposition of beta - amyloid. mutation which result in extension of the C - terminal end of the encode protein, thereby increase the size of the secrete peptide, be associate with two neurogenerative disease, familial British dementia and familial Danish dementia.
geneFunction: Amyloid precursor proteins are processed by beta-secretase and gamma-secretase to produce beta-amyloid peptides which form the characteristic plaques of Alzheimer disease. This gene encodes a transmembrane protein which is processed at the C-terminus by furin or furin-like proteases to produce a small secreted peptide which inhibits the deposition of beta-amyloid. Mutations which result in extension of the C-terminal end of the encoded protein, thereby increasing the size of the secreted peptide, are associated with two neurogenerative diseases, familial British dementia and familial Danish dementia.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a protein involve in glycolysis. The encode protein be a pyruvate kinase that catalyze the transfer of a phosphoryl group from phosphoenolpyruvate to ADP, generate ATP and pyruvate. This protein have be show to interact with thyroid hormone and may mediate cellular metabolic effect induce by thyroid hormone. This protein have be find to bind Opa protein, a bacterial outer membrane protein involve in gonococcal adherence to and invasion of human cell, suggest a role of this protein in bacterial pathogenesis. Several alternatively splice transcript variant encode a few distinct isoform have be report.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a protein involved in glycolysis. The encoded protein is a pyruvate kinase that catalyzes the transfer of a phosphoryl group from phosphoenolpyruvate to ADP, generating ATP and pyruvate. This protein has been shown to interact with thyroid hormone and may mediate cellular metabolic effects induced by thyroid hormones. This protein has been found to bind Opa protein, a bacterial outer membrane protein involved in gonococcal adherence to and invasion of human cells, suggesting a role of this protein in bacterial pathogenesis. Several alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding a few distinct isoforms have been reported.

lemmatized_summary: The protein encode by this gene be a member of the S100 family of protein contain 2 EF - hand calcium - bind motif. S100 protein be localize in the cytoplasm and / or nucleus of a wide range of cell, and involve in the regulation of a numb of cellular process such as cell cycle progression and differentiation. S100 gene include at less 13 member which be locate as a cluster on chromosome 1q21. This protein may function in stimulation of Ca2+ - dependent insulin release, stimulation of prolactin secretion, and exocytosis. Chromosomal rearrangement and alter expression of this gene have be implicate in melanoma.
geneFunction: The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the S100 family of proteins containing 2 EF-hand calcium-binding motifs. S100 proteins are localized in the cytoplasm and/or nucleus of a wide range of cells, and involved in the regulation of a number of cellular processes such as cell cycle progression and differentiation. S100 genes include at least 13 members which are located as a cluster on chromosome 1q21. This protein may function in stimulation of Ca2+-dependent insulin release, stimulation of prolactin secretion, and exocytosis. Chromosomal rearrangements and altered expression of this gene have been implicated in melanoma.

lemmatized_summary: The protein encode by this gene be involve in the attachment of osteoclast to the mineralized bone matrix. The encode protein be secrete and bind hydroxyapatite with high affinity. The osteoclast vitronectin receptor be find in the cell membrane and may be involve in the bind to this protein. This protein be also a cytokine that upregulates expression of interferon - gamma and interleukin - 12. Several transcript variant encode different isoform have be find for this gene.
geneFunction: The protein encoded by this gene is involved in the attachment of osteoclasts to the mineralized bone matrix. The encoded protein is secreted and binds hydroxyapatite with high affinity. The osteoclast vitronectin receptor is found in the cell membrane and may be involved in the binding to this protein. This protein is also a cytokine that upregulates expression of interferon-gamma and interleukin-12. Several transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene.

lemmatized_summary: This gene encode a protein that be a regulator of cellular growth and proliferation. Its mRNA be highly structure and contain a oligopyrimidine tract ( 5' - TOP ) in its 5' untranslated region that function to repress its translation under quiescent condition. The encode protein be involve in a variety of cellular pathway, include apoptosis, protein synthesis and cell division. It bind to and stabilize microtubule, and removal of this protein through phosphorylation be require for progression through mitotic and meiotic cell division. This gene be know to play a role in carcinogenesis, and be upregulated in some cancer cell. Alternative splice result in multiple transcript variant encode different isoform.
geneFunction: This gene encodes a protein that is a regulator of cellular growth and proliferation. Its mRNA is highly structured and contains an oligopyrimidine tract (5'-TOP) in its 5' untranslated region that functions to repress its translation under quiescent conditions. The encoded protein is involved in a variety of cellular pathways, including apoptosis, protein synthesis and cell division. It binds to and stabilizes microtubules, and removal of this protein through phosphorylation is required for progression through mitotic and meiotic cell divisions. This gene is known to play a role in carcinogenesis, and is upregulated in some cancer cells. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different isoforms.
